1.text: So let a man reckon us, as servants of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.

2.text: And besides it is sought in stewards, that any one be found faithful.

3.text: And to me it is the least that I be judged by you, or by manâ€™s day: but neither do I judge myself.

4.text: For I know nothing by myself; but in this I have not been justified: and he examining me is the Lord.

5.text: Therefore judge ye nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who also, will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and make manifest the counsels of hearts: and then shall praise be to each from God.

6.text: And these things, brethren, I transformed to myself and to Apollos for you; that ye might learn in us not to think above what has been written, lest ye be puffed up one above one against the other.

7.text: For who distinguishes thee? and what hast thou which thou didst not receive? and if thou also didst receive, why dost thou boast, as not having received?

8.text: Already were ye satisfied, already were ye rich, without us ye reigned; and I would ye also reigned, that we also might reign together with you.

9.text: For I think that God has exhibited us the last sent, as exposed to death; for we were a theatre to the world, and to messengers, and to men.

10.text: We foolish for Christ, and ye wise in Christ; we weak, and ye strong; ye honourable, and we dishonoured.

11.text: Until this present hour we also hunger, and thirst, and we are naked, and are cuffed, and are unsteady.

12.text: And we are wearied, working with our own hands: being reviled, we praise; being driven out, we hold up.

13.text: Being defamed, we entreat: as the filth of the world were we become, the offscouring of all until now.

14.text: Not shaming you, write I these, but as my beloved children I admonish you.

15.text: For if ye have ten thousand preceptors in Christ, but not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus by the good news I begat you.

16.text: I beseech you therefore, be ye imitators of me.

17.text: Therefore sent I Timotheus to you, who is my beloved child, and faithful in the Lord, who will remind you of all my ways in Christ, as I teach everywhere in all the churches.

18.text: And as my not coming to you, some were puffed up.

19.text: And I will come to you swiftly, if the Lord will, and I shall know not the word of those puffed up, but the power.

20.text: For the kingdom of God not in word, but in power.

21.text: What will ye? should I come to you with a rod, or in love, and in the spirit of meekness?
